meanings.definition: The property or phenomenon exhibited by a substance that is diamagnetic.
meanings.sent1: The diamagnetisms of the material caused it to repel the magnet.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study diamagnetisms to understand how certain materials react to magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about the diamagnetisms of the silly putty.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor had a diamagnetisms that repelled any negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun experiment to demonstrate the concept of diamagnetisms to the students.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being diamagnetic.
meanings.sent1: The diamagnetisms of the metal made it unsuitable for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the diamagnetisms of a material helps in predicting its behavior in a magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The party had a diamagnetisms that repelled any form of boredom.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style had a diamagnetisms that drew people to his work.
meanings.sent5: The concept of diamagnetisms is crucial in the field of physics.
